roleset.name: bias
roleset.note: PREPOSSESS-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. Added because none existed. No Vncls. Comparison to ?prejudice.01?. Roleset by Julia. (from prepossess.01-v)

roles.note: Arg-2, the bias, may be expressed adjectivally or prepositionally (favorably, with the opinion that..., in his favor..., against..., etc.) (from prepossess.01-v)

example.name: All args, Arg-2 adjectival
example.text: As much as possible should be learned in the first lessons, in order *PRO* to prepossess the pupils favorably.

example.name: Passive, with Arg-2 instrumental
example.text: Chatelart-1 was prepossessed *trace*-1 with an opinion that it belonged to the Duke of Nemours.
example.arg: with an opinion that it belonged to the Duke of Nemours.

example.name: All args
example.text: [His experience]-1 had not been likely *trace*-1 to prepossess him in favour of the popular voice.
example.arg: in favour of the popular voice.

example.name: All args
example.text: The Duchess of Valentinois prepossessed the King against it.
